scenario:
The pet friendly hotel market size has grown rapidly in recent years, from $3.66 billion in 2023 to $4.1 billion in 2024 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 12.4%. The growth is attributed to increased demand for pet-inclusive lodging, social media platforms, pet adoption, travel agencies, and luxurious hotels. The market is expected to grow to $6.55 billion in 2028 at a CAGR of 12.4%. Key trends include technological integration, product innovations, cat grooming services, smart technology for pet monitoring, and stay-and-play packages.

The growing trend of pet ownership is driving the expansion of the pet-friendly hotel market. Key players are concentrating on delivering innovative services, such as pet-friendly packages, to attract pet-owning travelers. These packages offer healthy food and drink options, custom pet beds, gourmet pet food, and pet-sitting services.

North America was the largest region in the pet friendly hotel market in 2023. The regions covered in the report are Asia-Pacific, Western Europe, Eastern Europe, North America, South America, Middle East, Africa. Key players in the pet-friendly hotel sector include Marriott International, Loews Hotels, PetSmart Inc., Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc., and InterContinental Hotels Group.

The report attributes the growth to factors such as rising pet ownership, increasing aging population, growing preference for environmentally conscious products, expansion in travel and tourism, and higher demand for specialized pet care services. The report also highlights the impact of high inflation, Ukraine-Russia war, and COVID-19 on the market.

Key attributes of the report include 175 pages, forecast period 2024-2028, estimated market value in 2024 of $4.1 billion, and forecasted market value by 2028 of $6.55 billion. The report covers global pet friendly hotel market size and growth, segmentation by type, booking, and application, and regional and country analysis.
